intro: Ilex buergeri, commonly known as the Japanese holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to Japan. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and dark green, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers in the spring, followed by red berries that are toxic to humans but serve as a food source for birds. Ilex buergeri is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
